name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites

reviews.title: A Great Deal for a Great Price!
reviews.text: We have had good experiences staying at Holiday Inn Express and this one was no exception. Located just off the 101, it is centrally located to all of the wineries. The room was clean, had a refrigerator and microwave, and was quiet even though we were right next to the elevator. There are train tracks running alongside the hotel, but the only train that passed by was at 6:00 p.m. The entire building shook, but there were no other trains. The warm cookies at night were yummy, and the free breakfast in the morning was convenient and plentiful. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: I'm glad we stayed at a Holiday Inn Expres last night
reviews.text: This Holiday Inn Express was the best hotel we visited on our trip. We really liked the friendly staff especially. The room we had I believe was a suite, was quite large with a living room. My kids liked the indoor pool as it was very cold during our visit. The in-room refrigerators and microswaves are a big plus and the free breakfast was a added value. The hotel is convenient to the downtown center where we ate dinner at a great little restaurant. Unfortunately, I can't remember the name, but it was near the town square. I wish we would of had time to do some wine tasting, but with small children that wasn't possible. Our plans were to visit Hearst Castle, which which I believe was about a 30 minute drive from Paso Robles the next day. I would highly recommend you seeing Hearst Castle if you plan to come to the Paso Robles area.

reviews.title: A pleasant visit to Paso Robles
reviews.text: We decided to stay at the Holiday Inn Express after reading the reviews here. We had planned to come Paso Robles to do some wine tasting. The Holiday Inn Express wasn't a disappointment. The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful. We really liked the indoor pool and spa after a day of wine tasting. I think we found a favorite winery at Tobin James. The people are great there and they even helped us prepare some wine for us to take home. One night we ate at this restaurant across the street from the hotel called Big Bubba's. It's fun place with a lively crowd. They even have a mechanical bull. One of the other nights we we ate at the steak house downtown. Good steaks. Overall our visit to Paso Robles was great. The hotel has a great breakfast in the morning and in the evening they bake cookies. You can smell them throughout the hotel.

reviews.title: Great Visit!
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel. We were really tired and were lucky to get this last room. The front desk were ladies were really helpful locating us a list of restaurants open late. We found he beds were really comfortable and clean. The next morning we enjoyed the hotels free breakfast, and of course those cinnimon rolls. We were able to take a swim in the the hotels indoor pool before we continued on our trip. If you ever go to Paso Robles this is the place to stay. Clean hotel and friendly staff. What else can you ask for.

We stopped at this hotel for two nights en route to San Francisco from Los Angeles. It was accommodation of a high standard and we would certainly stop here again. The hotel is found just off the Highway 101 northbound (exit Bakersfield/Fresno), turn left and then second right. The reception staff were very friendly and our children enjoyed using the free internet facility at reception. Our room was a good size and easily allowed us to have a rollaway bed as well. The breakfast each day was included in the price and we felt it was good.
reviews.title: Good stop en route to San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually stayed here last night. The location is great just off I95, and the hotel is only four months old as of this review. There is some construction going on nearby but we experienced no noise or disruptions. The front desk was helpful and very professional, we checked in and reserved with Preston. The hotel is very quiet and the patrons were all busy professional people, no noisy ones on our night. We got an upgrade to a handicapped suite which my husband needed for his limited mobility. The room had a fridge, a microwave, a coffee maker with it's own sink, a separate sitting room with a second flat screen TV and couch bed. The bathroom was large with a roll in shower. We saw the indoor pool which was overlooked by the modest sized fitness center and well lit so don't expect a lot of privacy if someone is working out, but it was nice and warm to the touch, no hot tub. The beds are wonderful standard HIE quality. The breakfast room is fantastic, large and roomy with a lot of tables and even booths, a TV and fireplace. The food itself was great, sausage patties, eggs, a variety of toasts, incl French, pastries and the signature cinnabons, cereals etc. great juice too. Everything at this hotel was enjoyable we highly recommend it. The area is very busy, high traffic with lots of fast food restaurants and stores within walking and driving distance.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: A friend and I were on a two week business/vacation and happened on to this hotel. What a treat for us! The rooms were clean, spacious and the staff was courteous, helpful and always available to help a weary traveler. The breakfast is standard but the servers respond to any request. I accidently left my camera in the parking lot. Someone brought it to the front desk and the staff returned to me. The location is perfect for touring Civil war battlefields and the town of Fredericksburg is a delight! Good restaurants and the best of all is the 'Cupcake' which serves the best cupcakes in the world. This hotel is near major highways and we used it as a base to travel to Appomattox and the Richmond area. We asked the staff if we could box up the room so we could take it with us.
reviews.title: Fredericksburg Area Many CW battlefields and plenty more to see

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a good location to the sights of the Fredericksburg Area, is a 30 minute drive away from the huge Potomac Mills outlet mall and one hour drive from Washington Dulles Intenational airport, so very convenient for the first or the last night coming from or going to Europe. The property itself is brand new openend in June 2010. Everything is looking and smelling new, the staff is great. They have one indoor and one outdoor pool and the fitness and business room are both stuffed good. The free breakfast is as always, nothing special, but clean and friendly. The rooms are very large. We had a suite which is not larger than usual rooms, but it is differently divided with two TV'S, very nice!
reviews.title: Nice suite in a brand new hotel
Great Location, Close to Wineries
reviews.text: Holiday Inn Express, Paso Robles offers many convenient amenities complimentary - breakfast, high speed internet, business center in lobby. fitness room.

reviews.title: Love those cinnamon rolls
reviews.text: Spacious, clean rooms. (some with whirpool bathtubs) Friendly service. Close to many wineries. You may want to plan to stay an extra day to go wine tasting, there are over 60 wine tasting rooms in Paso Robles and many great restaurants!!

We spent one night at this hotel on our way to So. Cal. We have friends in the area which seemed to be the case with other visitors, too. Our kids love the indoor pool and jacuzzi, and the evening cookies. The breakfast is wonderful, fresh baked cinnamon rolls, fruit, yogurt, muffins, toast, hard-boiled eggs, several kinds of juice, coffee and hot chocolate. Our room was nice and big, two queen beds and a sitting area. They also had a pullout clothesline in the shower area so we could hang up our bathing suits. Everyone on the staff was helpful and friendly. There are many fast food places nearby if you don't feel like getting in the car to look for dinner. The fairgrounds are walking distance, which is great except it means the price jumps during fair season.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Safe
Very nice.
reviews.text: Downside- the neighborhood is ugly, and the train tracks are right behind the building. For ambience, the Paso Robles Inn is right in the quaint downtown area and is much more romantic. However, we enjoyed all of our time at this hotel, and when we wanted to get out and walk around in the evening, we drove the short drive to downtown Paso Robles.

description: Enjoy a Hot Breakfast Buffet every morning and Evening Hospitality Reception during your stay. The Holiday Inn Express is conveniently located in the heart of Paso Robles Wine Country and across the street from the Paso Robles Event Center (Home of the California Mid-State Fair). Stay at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites in Paso Robles. Stay Smart!
